sn35.33-42:3.1: 33–42 Ten on Liable to Be Reborn, etc.
sn35.33-42:4.3: “Mendicants, all is liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:4.4: And what is the all that is liable to be reborn?
sn35.33-42:4.8: and eye contact are liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:4.9: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:4.16: The mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and mind contact are liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:4.17: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also liable to be reborn.
sn35.33-42:4.18: Seeing this a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned …
sn35.33-42:4.21: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn35.33-42:6.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to get old. …”
sn35.33-42:8.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to fall sick. …”
sn35.33-42:14.1: “Mendicants, all is liable to be corrupted. …”
